document.title: Visual and Performing Arts Content Standards for California Public Schools, Prekindergarten Through Grade Twelve

FD29CC60DFE3013198AE68A86D17958E.description: Research and report on what various types of artists (e.g., architects, designers, graphic artists, animators) produce and how their works play a role in our everyday environ-ment.

FD2938F0DFE3013198AC68A86D17958E.description: Identify and design icons, logos, and other graphic devices as symbols for ideas and information.

FD289230DFE3013198AA68A86D17958E.description: Use linear perspective to depict geometric objects in space.

FD27F180DFE3013198A868A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in the Visual Arts to Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FD27A540DFE3013198A768A86D17958E.description: Assess their own works of art, using specific criteria, and describe what changes they would make for improvement.

FD2757F0DFE3013198A668A86D17958E.description: Develop and use specific criteria as individuals and in groups to assess works of art.

FD26A260DFE3013198A468A86D17958E.description: Compare the different purposes of a specific culture for creating art.

FD265470DFE3013198A368A86D17958E.description: Identify how selected principles of design are used in a work of art and how they affect personal responses to and evaluation of the work of art.

FD25C9F0DFE3013198A168A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works in the Visual Arts

FD258260DFE3013198A068A86D17958E.description: View selected works of art from a major culture and observe changes in materials and styles over a period of time.

FD253210DFE30131989F68A86D17958E.description: Identify and compare works of art from various regions of the United States.

FD2472E0DFE30131989D68A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe various fine, traditional, and folk arts from historical periods worldwide.

FD242EE0DFE30131989C68A86D17958E.description: Describe how local and national art galleries and museums contribute to the conversation of art.

FD23E8E0DFE30131989B68A86D17958E.description: Role and Development of the Visual Arts

FD23A200DFE30131989A68A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of the Visual Arts

FD235490DFE30131989968A86D17958E.description: Communicate values, opinions, or personal insights through an original work of art.

FD22FE10DFE30131989868A86D17958E.description: Use perspective in an original work of art to create a real or imaginary scene.

FD22B740DFE30131989768A86D17958E.description: Assemble a found object sculpture (as assemblage) or a mixed media two-dimensional composition that reflects unity and harmony and communicates a theme.

FD227360DFE30131989668A86D17958E.description: Create an expressive abstract composition based on real objects.

FD222BE0DFE30131989568A86D17958E.description: Communication and Expression Through Original Works of Art

FD21DA00DFE30131989468A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate beginning skill in the manipulation of digital imagery (e.g., computer-generated art, digital photography, or videography).

FD2188E0DFE30131989368A86D17958E.description: Create gesture and contour observational drawings.

FD212280DFE30131989268A86D17958E.description: Use one-point perspective to create the illusion of space.

FD207CF0DFE30131989068A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in the Visual Arts

FD2037C0DFE30131988F68A86D17958E.description: Use their knowledge of all the elements of art to describe similarities and differences in works of art and in the environment.

FD1FF050DFE30131988E68A86D17958E.description: Analyze Art Elements and Principles of Design

FD1F9AD0DFE30131988D68A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe characteristics of representational, abstract, and nonrepresenta-tional works of art.

FD1F3320DFE30131988C68A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe the principles of design in visual compositions, emphasizing unity and harmony.

FD1EC8E0DFE30131988B68A86D17958E.description: Develop Perceptual Skills and Visual Arts Vocabulary

FD1E84F0DFE30131988A68A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to the Visual Arts

FD1DF3E0DFE30131988868A86D17958E.description: Identify the roles and responsibilities of performing and technical artists in theatre, film, television, and electronic media.

FD1D5CC0DFE30131988668A86D17958E.description: Use theatrical skills to dramatize events and concepts from the other curriculum areas, such as reenacting the signing of the Declaration of Independence in historyâ€“social science.

FD1CCFF0DFE30131988468A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Theatre, Film/Video, and Electronic Media to Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FD1C85F0DFE30131988368A86D17958E.description: Describe devices actors use to convey meaning or intent in commercials on television.

FD1C2F70DFE30131988268A86D17958E.description: Derivation of Meaning from Works of Theatre

FD1BD590DFE30131988168A86D17958E.description: Develop and apply appropriate criteria for critiquing the work of actors, directors, writers, and technical artists in theatre, film, and video.

FD1B4260DFE30131987F68A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Critiquing Theatrical Experiences

FD1AF7A0DFE30131987E68A86D17958E.description: Identify types of early American theatre, such as melodrama and musical theatre.

FD1AAAF0DFE30131987D68A86D17958E.description: Analyze ways in which theatre, television, and film play a part in our daily lives.

FD19FE70DFE30131987B68A86D17958E.description: Interpret how theatre and storytelling forms (past and present) of various cultural groups may reflect their beliefs and traditions.

FD19A600DFE30131987A68A86D17958E.description: Select or create appropriate props, sets, and costumes for a cultural celebration or pageant.

FD193940DFE30131987968A86D17958E.description: Role and Cultural Significance of Theatre

FD18B5B0DFE30131987868A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Theatre

FD186E10DFE30131987768A86D17958E.description: Collaborate as an actor, director, scriptwriter, or technical artist in creating formal or informal theatrical performances.

FD17DF00DFE30131987568A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the use of blocking (stage areas, levels, and actor's position, such as full front, quarter, profile, and full back) in dramatizations.

FD179870DFE30131987468A86D17958E.description: Participate in improvisational activities to explore complex ideas and universal themes in literature and life.

FD1708B0DFE30131987268A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Theatre

FD16AE30DFE30131987168A86D17958E.description: Identify the structural elements of plot (exposition, complication, crisis, climax, and resolution) in a script or theatrical experience.

FD1666F0DFE30131987068A86D17958E.description: Comprehension and Analysis of the Elements of Theatre

FD161FB0DFE30131986F68A86D17958E.description: Use the vocabulary of theatre, such as sense memory, script, cue, monologue, dialogue, protagonist, and antagonist, to describe theatrical experiences.

FD15D390DFE30131986E68A86D17958E.description: Development of the Vocabulary of Theatre

FD1581F0DFE30131986D68A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Theatre

FD14C390DFE30131986B68A86D17958E.description: Identify ways in which the music professions are similar to or different from one another.

FD142800DFE30131986968A86D17958E.description: Explain the role of music in community events.

FD138020DFE30131986768A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Music to Learning in Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FD1320D0DFE30131986668A86D17958E.description: Identify and analyze differences in tempo and dynamics in contrasting music selections.

FD128B30DFE30131986468A86D17958E.description: Develop and apply appropriate criteria to support personal preferences for specific musical works.

FD11FB80DFE30131986268A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works of Music

FD11A920DFE30131986168A86D17958E.description: Describe the social functions of a variety of musical forms from various cultures and time periods (e.g., folk songs, dances).

FD10EE60DFE30131985F68A86D17958E.description: Describe the influences of various cultures on the music of the United States.

FD10A8F0DFE30131985E68A86D17958E.description: Describe the influence of various cultures and historical events on musical forms and styles.

FD106090DFE30131985D68A86D17958E.description: Sing and play music from diverse cultures and time periods.

FD100C80DFE30131985C68A86D17958E.description: Identify different or similar uses of musical elements in music from diverse cultures.

FD0F54E0DFE30131985A68A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Music

FD0F00D0DFE30131985968A86D17958E.description: Compose, improvise, and perform basic rhythmic, melodic, and chordal patterns inde-pendently on classroom instruments.

FD0E74A0DFE30131985768A86D17958E.description: Use classroom instruments to play melodies and accompaniments from a varied reper-toire of music from diverse cultures, including rounds, descants, and ostinatos and two-part harmony, by oneself and with others.

FD0E2A80DFE30131985668A86D17958E.description: Sing a varied repertoire of music, including rounds, descants, and songs with ostinatos and songs in two-part harmony, by oneself and with others.

FD0D7F60DFE30131985468A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Music

FD0D2C30DFE30131985368A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe music forms, including theme and variations and twelve-bar blues.

FD0CE400DFE30131985268A86D17958E.description: Identify vocal and instrumental ensembles from a variety of genres and cultures.

FD0C9B90DFE30131985168A86D17958E.description: Analyze the use of music elements in aural examples from various genres and cultures.

FD0C5170DFE30131985068A86D17958E.description: Listen to, Analyze, and Describe Music

FD0C05E0DFE30131984F68A86D17958E.description: Read, write, and perform rhythmic notation, including quarter-note triplets and tied syncopation.

FD0BAB20DFE30131984E68A86D17958E.description: Read, write, and perform major and minor scales.

FD0B59B0DFE30131984D68A86D17958E.description: Read, write, and perform simple melodic notation in treble clef in major and minor keys.

FD0ACF70DFE30131984B68A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Music

FD0A2C90DFE30131984968A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate social skills that enable students to become leaders/teachers and followers/ learners.

FD09CEC0DFE30131984868A86D17958E.description: Development of Life Skills and Career Competencies

FD097C00DFE30131984768A86D17958E.description: Cite examples of the use of technology in the performing arts.

FD0935F0DFE30131984668A86D17958E.description: Describe how dancing requires good health-related habits (e.g., individual and group goals for flexibility, strength, endurance, stress management, nutrition).

FD08ED50DFE30131984568A86D17958E.description: Describe how historical events relate to dance forms (e.g., the rebellion of the 1960s was represented in popular social dances with a move from partners to individual expres-sion).

FD083850DFE30131984368A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Dance to Learning in Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FD07CB30DFE30131984268A86D17958E.description: Explain how outstanding dancers affect audience members emotionally or intellectually.

FD0783B0DFE30131984168A86D17958E.description: Identify the special and challenging characteristics of the experience of dancing for an audience.

FD06F340DFE30131983F68A86D17958E.description: Apply specific criteria to analyze and assess the quality of a dance performance by well-known dancers or dance companies (e.g., technical skill, musicality, dynamics, mood).

FD06AAF0DFE30131983E68A86D17958E.description: Use dance vocabulary to identify and support personal preferences for dances observed or performed.

FD065D50DFE30131983D68A86D17958E.description: Description, Analysis, and Criticism of Dance

FD0605B0DFE30131983C68A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works of Dance

FD05B870DFE30131983B68A86D17958E.description: Select traditional dances that men, women, or children perform and explain the purpose(s) of the dances.

FD050EE0DFE30131983968A86D17958E.description: Identify and perform folk/traditional, social, and theatrical dances done by Americans in the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries.

FD046D10DFE30131983768A86D17958E.description: Describe how and why a traditional dance may be changed when performed on stage for an audience.

FD03BF90DFE30131983568A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Dance

FD037A30DFE30131983468A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate cooperation, collaboration, and empathy in working with partners and in groups (e.g., leading/following, mirroring, calling/responding, echoing, opposing).

FD033390DFE30131983368A86D17958E.description: Development of Partner and Group Skills

FD02E660DFE30131983268A86D17958E.description: Convey a wide range of feeling and expression through gestures, posture, and movement.

FD020740DFE30131983068A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate principles of opposing weight and force/energy, balance and counterbal-ance, or cantilever.

FD01BE30DFE30131982F68A86D17958E.description: Describe and incorporate simple dance forms in dance studies (e.g., AB form, canon).

FD017580DFE30131982E68A86D17958E.description: Application of Choreographic Principles and Processes to Creating Dance

FD012C70DFE30131982D68A86D17958E.description: Invent multiple possibilities to solve a given movement problem and analyze problem-solving strategies and solutions.

FD00E270DFE30131982C68A86D17958E.description: Create, memorize, and perform complex sequences of movement with greater focus, force/energy, and intent.

FD004D70DFE30131982A68A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Dance

FD000B10DFE30131982968A86D17958E.description: Use appropriate dance vocabulary to describe dances.

FCFF8270DFE30131982768A86D17958E.description: Incorporate the principles of variety, contrast, and unity with dance studies.

FCFF3700DFE30131982668A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate a greater dynamic range in movement utilizing space, time, and force/ energy concepts.

FCFEE780DFE30131982568A86D17958E.description: Comprehension and Analysis of Dance Elements

FCFE9720DFE30131982468A86D17958E.description: Name and use a wide variety of movements (e.g., isolations/whole body).

FCFE4F40DFE30131982368A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate focus, physical control (e.g., proper alignment, balance), and coordination in performing locomotor and axial movement.

FCFE02A0DFE30131982268A86D17958E.description: Development of Motor Skills and Technical Expertise

FCFD9670DFE30131982168A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception â€“ Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Dance
